message_1: What is the truth value of the proposition "p ∧ ¬p", where p represents the statement "2 + 2 = 5"?
message_2: The proposition "p ∧ ¬p" is a contradiction, meaning it is always false. In this case, p represents the statement "2 + 2 = 5", which is false. Therefore, ¬p (not p) is true. Since p is false and ¬p is true, the proposition "p ∧ ¬p" is false.
